title: How to get algae out of a pool without a vacuum - Quora

response.answer_text: Most swimming pool owners do not know that the constant cleaning of the pool keeps it safe from algae invasion. Therefore, it is crucial to clean the pool regularly to keep it safe and clean for swimming How to clean these pools without a vacuum cleaner is another issue to pool owners- cleaning the pool with their bare hands can be tedious and labor-demanding. In the hand method, you will need to use a firm brush to carefully and gently brush the dirt at the bottom and sides of the pool. After collecting debris from the bottom of the pool, use an attachment and garden hose to remove the dirt and algae from the bottom of your swimming pool Conclusion It is often phrased that prevention is better than cure- while cleanliness is next to God. These two should apply when it comes to pool maintenance. Clean the pool regularly, not to get infested with algae and large debris. Change the pool water often to keep away the growth of algae. You can also check if the pool is affected by algae by testing if your pool pump works efficiently. The more water circulation, the higher chances of algae absence

response.answer_text: Hello, the problem with the algue is its roots, it means you usually fight against the algue surface scratching it, but the root is still there ready to grow up again. To fight for success you can do it with a superchlorine treatment, more than 30ppm, or even better 50ppm, adding chlorine at sundown, and scratching the algue after adding the chlorine, this kill the roots. You can use sodium hypochlorite. Avoid the bath for 3 days minimum.
